H0.text: Continental shelves are the deepest parts of the ocean.

H1.text: Continental slopes are the deepest parts of the ocean.

H2.text: Ocean trenches are the deepest parts of the ocean.

H3.text: Abyssal plains are the deepest parts of the ocean.

A4.text: The greatest ocean depth measured is in the Challenger Deep of the Mariana Trench, at a depth of 10,994 m (36,070 ft) below sea level.

A5.text: Because trenches are the lowest points in the ocean floor, there is concern that plastic debris may accumulate in trenches and endanger the fragile trench biomes.
